favourite.article: "But the beaming of His beauty, the unveiling of His heart" This words reminded me that it is by His beauty and His love that we love Him today. It is not that we wanted to love Him by ourselves. But that, we love Him because we are captivated by His beauty and constrained by His love.

How precious it is to have heard Him and seen Him, the fairest of all, the One with divine glory and human beauty. The more we are captivated by His beauty, the more we are fastened to Him. As we gaze on Him & behold Him we are being transformed into precious onyx stones and are being prepared to be the bride, adorned for our Beloved.
This hymn reminds me of God's love and preciousness again! It motivates me to consecrate myself and release my academic burdens to the Lord. I'm told to just love Him!
Draw and win and fill us completely! Till our spirits overflow the brim!
Captivated by His beauty.
How can I find the music? I just came across the words in a book by Watchman Nee and had never heard them before. I want to learn it and sing it at our church!

Having just arrived home from 10 days following Paul's steps on his second missionary Journey as he brought the Gospel to Europe (and ultimately to us in the West). Acts 16 and on tells the amazing story. I was reminded again of his determination above all things to proclaim nothing but 'Jesus Christ and Him crucified' - in spite of the religious resistance of Jewish tradition or the Gentile philosophies of mythological gods or pagan practices and plethora of dead icons and idols - still present today among the ruins. This song that I learned as a little girl, came to mind and stirred my heart to love the Lord Jesus more. He is the One the Apostles lifted high in spite of the corrupt culture around them. 'What have we do to with idols, who have companied with Him?' Luke 24:25-27
Captivated by His beauty! Lord Jesus, I love You.
I love You Lord!

That look that melted Peter, that face that Stephen saw, that heart that wept with Mary...Oh what a beautiful Christ we have! Lord Jesus You are King forever!
Oh Lord Jesus I really do love You!

Matt. 5:8 says, " Blessed are the pure in heart, for they shall see God." This song really touches our heart. Peter, Stephen, and Mary had a pure heart and saw God. May we all deal with our hearts to turn from the seeming beauty of the earthly idols and look into the face of the Lord. Then we too will be fully captured by the One of Peerless Worth!

Anything that replaces God is an idol. We can't deny the fact that there are still so many idols within us. So what do I/we do with idols? Just 3 points to kill the idols: LOOK (just like Peter's experience), FACE (like Stephen's experience) and HEART (like Mary's experience). How we need to SEE HIM, how we need to HEAR HIM, and how we need to KNOW HIM. So PRAISE GOD, I'm also one among ten thousands CAPTIVATED by the Lord's beauty.
How true it is, that only "that look," "that face," and "that heart" can strip the seeming beauty from the idols of the earth! Yes Lord, mine is a captured heart!
I was just recently impressed on "the look that melted peter". We have such a loving Christ.
